Thanks for merging, Suresh. I will refresh web site.
@sandhyasun, there is an e-mail on the dev list where @traflm lists this JIRA (TRAFODION-2935) as a must-fix for the next RC3 build of Release 2.2.
Ok. Th JIRA is not marked as a blocker and testing with kerberos wasn't part of the goal for the 2.2 release I thought. But will let the release manager decide and mark it as needed. Thanks !

Actually, it is a regression.  Kerberos has been available on Trafodion for the last several releases.   I test it before every release.
This bug will not allow any installation that has Kerberos enabled to work.

If no one is using Kerberos or plans to use Kerberos, then it won’t be an issue.  However, our documentation states that Kerberos is supported.

     Roberta

When I made the original set of changes, I was largely ignorant of the event_log_reader UDF. Hans' comments brings this up. After thinking about it, it seems to me that in the spirit of integrating the UPDATE STATISTICS logs with the other SQL logs, I should make them compatible with the event_log_reader as well. So, in the rework, I have done so. The rework has three changes:

1. The row format is now the same as other SQL logs, so event_log_reader should be able to process them.
2. The file names have been restricted so now they always begin with the ustat prefix. The function of the CQD USTAT_LOG has been modified somewhat to achieve that goal. The file name portion of that CQD will now be used as a second qualifier in the ULOG name. (The default has been changed to the empty string, so by default there is no added second qualifier.) So, for example, if I have CQD USTAT_LOG 'birdsall' in place, any ULOGs produced by me will have file name ustat.birdsall.node.pid.timestamp.log. This addresses the concern about accidentally naming a ULOG "mon.something"; it will no longer be possible to do this.
3. I've updated the analyzeULOG.py script to deal with the new line format. It can still handle the old too; but one will have to supply the parameter --ULOGFormat old in order for it to do so.
I will try to review this Monday.

@xwq In the pull request of https://github.com/apache/trafodion/pull/1300, original vcproj files were unintended upgraded to vs2015 version.  So this pull request makes the original vcproj files back to support vs2013 and add .vs2015.vcproj files to support vs2015 to convenient different developers.

This change is not yet enabled. It can be enabled for testing via  cqd use_libhdfs_scan 'off'. I am still working on the failures seen with hive test suite regressions with this change. Please do not merge yet. I will be making one more change to this pull request.
+1 from me, but I am not as familiar with the code as Suresh is. I looked at the overall change and liked it but did not get into a lot of details.

I changed the default for CQD USTAT_AUTOMATIC_LOGGING to "ON". I did this after doing a test to measure the overhead of having automatic logging on. My data showed that the cost was about 0.32 seconds of elapsed time per UPDATE STATISTICS command on average. This is in the realm of noise, as the elapsed time of repeated UPDATE STATISTICS commands on the same table varies more than this.
Thanks for the responses. I will merge this today.
I merged PR 1440 earlier this morning; I am guessing that caused the merge conflict here. Apologies.
